title: Trending: Upcycled Cosmetics, Circular Beauty - Cosmetics & Toiletries
summary: Upcycled cosmetic ingredients are gaining popularity as consumers become more interested in sustainable products. Upcycled cosmetics are made with ingredients that would otherwise be discarded, such as coffee grounds or orange peels. This helps to reduce waste and create more sustainable products.

title: Sustainable side-stream management in Swedish food processing companies using external actors and biogas solutions - Frontiers
summary: This article discusses the role of side-stream management in food processing companies and how they can contribute to environmental sustainability goals. It finds that most companies prefer to use external actors for side-stream management and for processing them into high-value products rather than developing and investing in the technology themselves. Biogas solutions are identified as having a special role in side-stream management due to their versatility and multifunctional nature.

greenwashing: No indication of greenwashing in this article.

title: Upcycling Initiatives Turn Railway Industry Waste Materials into Creative Products - The Japan News
summary: Railroad companies in Japan are finding new ways to reuse discarded items, creating a circular economy and attracting new fans. Upcycled products include slippers made from Shinkansen seat covers, shoehorns from overhead wires, and iron kettles from melted-down rails. These products are not only environmentally friendly, but also help to promote the railroad companies.
product_or_process: Slippers made from discarded Shinkansen seat covers

title: Tortilla chips category continues to grow - Snack Food & Wholesale Bakery
summary: The tortilla chip category has experienced an increase in sales, due in part to the increased popularity of at-home snacking. There is a growing trend towards healthier tortilla chips, with many brands now offering products that are made with whole grains, legumes, or vegetables. Several brands are also investing in sustainability, using upcycled ingredients and reducing their water footprint.

title: Q&A: Carbonwave expands seaweed emulsifier as demand grows - CosmeticsDesign.com USA
summary: Carbonwave, a Puerto Rico-based company, has secured $5 million in funding to expand production of its award-winning cosmetic emulsifier, SeaBalance 2000. SeaBalance 2000 is the world's first seaweed-based cosmetic emulsifier, made from Sargassum seaweed that is upcycled from the world's largest seaweed bloom. SeaBalance 2000 is a sustainable and multifunctional ingredient that provides a silicone-like hand feel and is also effective in cold process formulations.
green_innovation: TRUE. SeaBalance 2000 is a green innovation because it is a new product that contributes to environmental sustainability goals by reducing or replacing harmful substances (petroleum-based emulsifiers) and reducing resource consumption by using a waste biomass (Sargassum seaweed).
business_innovation: TRUE. SeaBalance 2000 is a business innovation because it is a new product that differs significantly from the company's previous products and has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE. SeaBalance 2000 is a green product because it is a good or service that is designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: FALSE. The article does not describe a new or improved business process.
likely_naics_codes: ['325611: Soap and Other Detergent Manufacturing', '325620: Toilet Preparation Manufacturing', '562998: All Other Miscellaneous Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing', '311999: All Other Miscellaneous Food Manufacturing']
greenwashing: FALSE. SeaBalance 2000 is not an example of greenwashing because the article provides evidence to support the environmental benefits of the product.

title: Singapore's Confetti Snacks in talks with Walmart and Target as collaboration with Dole and Disney lays on the horizon - FoodNavigator-Asia.com
summary: Confetti, a company that upcycles "ugly" produce into chips, has experienced significant growth in the US and APAC regions. The company is currently in talks with Dole to develop a line of vegan dips using the latter's surplus fruit and by-products. Confetti is also preparing to launch a special line of chips featuring Mickey and Friends characters on the packaging.

title: Tiger breaks beer-making boundaries to keep up with 'sessionable and accessible' drinking trends - FoodNavigator-Asia.com
summary: Tiger Beer has launched a new Soju Infused Lager in two flavors, Gutsy Grape and Cheeky Plum, in Singapore and Vietnam, with plans to roll it out to other markets soon. The beer is inspired by the popular Korean alcoholic beverage combination somaek and is designed to appeal to younger consumers who are looking for flavorful and easy-to-drink beers. Tiger has partnered with South Korean superstar G-DRAGON as its global brand ambassador for the new product.
